intro: Allium gramineum var. ampeloprasoides, commonly known as the mountain leek, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like leaves and small, clustered white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It is often found in the alpine zones of countries such as France, Italy, and Spain. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and protected areas.
